Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 1. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane: - Sketch a circle (circle\\_1) with a radius of 0.375 units at the coordinates [0.375, 0.375]. - Sketch another circle (circle\\_1) with a radius of 0.2379 units at the same coordinates [0.375, 0.375]. 1. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale with a value of 0.75. 2. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 3. Extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.6068 units - Extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 units **Part 2: Cylindrical Object with Tapered Bottom** Create a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, slightly tapered towards the bottom. 1. Extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.4163 units - Extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 units These parts will be used to create the final cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, a smooth surface, and a central hole running through its length.</description>
